alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; San Francisco River Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 01 at 10:42PM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches except between 3 and 8 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph producing blowing snow. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Far Northwest Highlands, Northwest Highlands, West Central Plateau, West Central Mountains, San Francisco River Valley, and Upper Rio Grande Valley. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40 from the Continental Divide to the AZ border. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
